translated: The Elder Nuns’ Verses of the Therīs🔽The Group of Ones
On the day of the full moon,
I was a slave girl in a pot-maker’s family.
Seeing the army with the king,
‘The king has given up his kingdom
Surely this deed will have fruit,
and having seen the danger in poverty,
in the dispensation of the Perfectly Awakened One,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
There my deed was well done,
It is like a fine peaked house,
beautifully decorated with a great seat.
Hundreds of thousands of celestial nymphs
this is the fruit of the Uposatha.
this is the fruit of the Uposatha.🔽Golden, silver,

analyzed: atha upi phalikāmaya  lohitaṅgamayan ca iva
sabbam paṭilabhāmaha  koseyya kambaliyāni  khoma kappāsikāni ca
translated: I obtained all of these.🔽Silk blankets,🔽fine linen, cotton,
this is the fruit of the Uposatha.🔽The best perfumes and garlands,
this is the fruit of the Uposatha.
this is the fruit of the Uposatha.
I had been born seven years,🔽I went forth into homelessness.
Not even half a month had passed
there is no more renewed existence.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the Uposatha.
How welcome it was for me
I have done what the Buddha taught.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ ekūposathikā bhikkhunī imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam ekūposathikā bhikkhunī imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done what the Buddha taught.”🔽Thus spoke the nun Ekūposathikā, and the Elder Nun Dukanipata
The Story of the Elder Nun Ekūposathikā is finished.
